qas.question: What are the financial districts of London known as?

answers.text: the City of London and Canary Wharf

qas.question: High-rise buildings may be restricted to prevent obstruction of what views?

answers.text: St Paul's Cathedral and other historic buildings

qas.question: What is the European Union's tallest building?
How high does the Shard London Bridge rise?
Most of London's skyscrapers are located where?

context: In the dense areas, most of the concentration is via medium- and high-rise buildings. London's skyscrapers such as 30 St Mary Axe, Tower 42, the Broadgate Tower and One Canada Square are mostly <a4_0>in the two financial districts<a4_0/>, <a0_0>the City of London and Canary Wharf<a0_0/>. High-rise development is restricted at certain sites if it would obstruct protected views of <a1_0>St Paul's Cathedral and other historic buildings<a1_0/>. Nevertheless, there are a number of very tall skyscrapers in central London (see Tall buildings in London), including the <a3_0>95-storey<a3_0/> <a2_0>Shard London Bridge<a2_0/>, the tallest building in the European Union.
